author: Scarlet Howes
title: UK Muslim schoolteacher removed from flight after being denied entry to USA following Trump immigration ban
text:
UK Muslim schoolteacher removed from flight after being denied entry to USA following Trump immigration ban Juhel Miah was escorted from the aircraft by security personnel on flight from Reykjavik to New York Share President Trump signs an executive order to ban travellers from seven Muslim countries into entering US (Photo: Getty) Share Get politics   
A Muslim schoolteacher was denied entry to the USA while travelling with pupils on a school trip. 
Juhel Miah, from Wales, was heading to New York after initially travelling to Iceland last week. 
When Mr Miah boarded the onward flight in Reykjavik on February 16 she was escorted from the aircraft by security personnel. 
Whilst the school trip, from Llangatwg Comprehensive in Aberdulais, proceeded as planned, Mr Miah's removal from the flight left pupils and colleagues "shocked and distressed". 
Neath Port Talbot County Borough Council has today written to the Embassy of the United States of America in London to express its dismay at the treatment of one of its employees, who has been denied entry to the US as a member of a school party. 
An authority spokesperson says they understand that Mr Miah was refused permission by the United States authorities to fly to New York, despite being issued with a valid visa for travel. 
He is described as a "popular and respected teacher" at the school, Wales Online reported. Read More Donald Trump's anti-media campaign 'is how dictators get started' claims REPUBLICAN John McCain President Trump's revised travel ban has not yet been signed (Photo: REUTERS) 
A council spokesperson said: “We are appalled by the treatment of Mr Miah and are demanding an explanation. The matter has also been raised with our local Member of Parliament. 
"No satisfactory reason has been provided for refusing entry to the United States – either at the airport in Iceland or subsequently at the US Embassy in Reykjavik. Read More 
"Mr Miah attempted to visit the Embassy; but was denied access to the building. Understandably he feels belittled and upset at what appears to be an unjustified act of discrimination.” 
The US embassy has been approached for comment. 
The reason for the US refusing entry to Mr Miah is unclear at the moment. Read More What time are Stop Trump protests? Everything you need to know as MPs debate banning President's state visit Llangatwg Comprehensive in Aberdulais, Neath Port Talbot (Photo: google) 
President Donald Trump's travel ban initially triggered chaos at airports around the world, as travellers from seven Muslim-majority nations were stopped in transit. 
But the order has been suspended during a court battle and Mr Trump's revised order, which is understood to be being developed at the moment, has not yet been signed. Read More
